website_summaries.verdict: This men's backpack is good for warm weather overnights, or day outings in the winter. You may wish to buy up a size, however, to get a little extra space.
pros: Has 8 exterior pockets in all (many of them quick-access), as well as one interior slip and one interior zip pocket
Comes in a variety of colors, including burnished orange and feldspar gray
cons: Sizing on this pack runs a little small
Some feel the metal cross bracing can be uncomfortable

customer_reviews.title: Lighweight, trouble-free, but some design deficiencies
customer_reviews.text: I used this backpack on the Camino de Santiago for 3 weeks. It is lightweight, rugged, and the size is perfect for such a trek. It would benefit from an additional outside pouch. The metal cross bracing is uncomfortably close to the mesh support webbing, and it will poke you in the back if you are not careful with loading.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_shopper

customer_reviews.title: This pack is excellent! It’s become my daypack for when I need ...
customer_reviews.text: This pack is excellent! It’s become my daypack for when I need lots of gear (fishing, winter, cameras) travel up to a week, summer hikes up to 4 days all around great pack. It’s light, holds lots or little, comes with perfect size rain cover (clutch in PNW). Plenty of organization: two zippered pockets in brain, top and front entry to main area, 3 big stretch pockets outside (front and sides) and zippered hip belt pockets big enough for small gadgets or snacks.
customer_reviews.author: Max L.

customer_reviews.title: This backpack held up nicely and was just the right size to be considered ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this backpack ahead of my solotrip to Western Europe. This backpack held up nicely and was just the right size to be considered as a carry-on even for a budget airline like Wow. The interior is nice and spacious and managed to hold multiple massive bottles of beer I picked up in Belgium along with all of my clothes/toiletries/etc. If you use the straps, it disperses the weight quite evenly throughout your body. I highly recommend this backpack if you're looking for a solid, durable travel bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff C

customer_reviews.title: Tool bag, book bag, ultralight hiking. LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: Love. This. Pack. When I'm not outdoors I am a handyman in NYC and need to carry tools all over the city. I've repurposed the pack as a tool bag when it's not on the trail (I know the poor backpack). This would be equally back saving for any student with a huge amount of text books. Gregory has always had amazing fit and this does the job. I am just starting to get serious about ultralight multi-day hikes so this is my training bag. I am amazed at how well it distributes weight, etc.
customer_reviews.author: posture.coach

customer_reviews.title: Quality is not Compromised
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is so light but they have not compromised on quality. There is nothing that has been forgotten on this design. When you wear it, you forget it is on your back. I love the main compartment which can be open from the top or near the bottom if you want to retrieve something near the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: DougR

customer_reviews.title: Great pack but not adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Great pack. Just sucks that it doesn't fit. Wish the torso was adjustable. No way to get all the weight off my shoulders or hips, depending on the size I tried. I need like a small-small/medium. That doesn't exist..
customer_reviews.author: Jake Sansing

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent day/overnight pack. Nice design, features, good materials and construction.
customer_reviews.author: Munib P. Jalali

customer_reviews.title: Lack size customization
customer_reviews.text: Great pack but the sizing is very.... yea not so great in customizing the hip belt to the shoulders so that the weight goes to the hips. Med is too big. Small is way to small.
customer_reviews.author: Rober P

customer_reviews.title: A great comfortable hiking bag
customer_reviews.text: The best hiking bag i ever had. I bought this one before doing the TMB. Very comfortable very durable. The best small pockets in the right places.
customer_reviews.author: Liron

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY comfortable compared to others with their incredible back support
customer_reviews.text: Have spent 2mo taking this around the world and it hasn't shown an ounce of wear. Will be using this until I can't backpack anymore. A++ product. EXTREMELY comfortable compared to others with their incredible back support. Did HEAVY research looking into this and am beyond pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Best 40L you can buy
customer_reviews.text: Amazing backpack. Using in SE Asia right now. 40L is perfect size to bring a weeks worth of clothes, toiletries, and some electronics. Very comfortable, durable, and functional. Couldn't be happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Placek

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a casual trip through New Zealand! Spent a month with the pack with no trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Gregory Zulu 40
customer_reviews.text: Great pack. Took it on two hikes (20 miles) with about 20 lbs. Couldn't tell it was there. Lots of space. Easy to get to everything. Nice padded hip belt.
customer_reviews.author: Mooser596

customer_reviews.title: Very nice pack. 40 liters is just the right size ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice pack. 40 liters is just the right size for a 2-3 day hike. The Zulu 40 sits very well and makes a fully-loaded pack seem to disappear. Very impressed. Well-made and many small features make this a super pack.
customer_reviews.author: Wally Gee

customer_reviews.title: Geegory packs are the Gold standard
customer_reviews.text: Typical Gregory ... Well designed, excellent quality. Happy to own Gregory packs.
customer_reviews.author: W. B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it. What can I say? Light and very comfortable, even when full.
customer_reviews.author: Teddy Tradmanovic

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Backpack
customer_reviews.text: Great backpack. I used my backpack to hike down the Grand Canyon and it worked out perfectly for me. It was light-weight, comfortable, and had plenty of storage space. It was big enough but not to big. FYI: The hydration packs are sold separately. Helpful tip: I recommend going to REI and get fitted for a backpack. I had no idea that they come in different sizes. I was completely ignorant to backpacking since I have never done it before. The people at REI were extremely helpful. Every backpack I tried on had a different comfort feel to it. At REI they will put weights in the backpack so you could get the real feel of a full backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everything great except one
customer_reviews.text: Everything great except one ... My back size 49-50, so i tried medium, it was small. Large size was a little bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Pavel N.

customer_reviews.title: Like an Unnoticed Body Part
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for the many ups and downs of the 102 mile Cotswold Way[U.K,] Strap adjustments are so good that most of the time, 7-9 hours per day, I didn't feel the pack.Separate pouch for water bladder. Mine was 3 liters.Multiple compartments. Easy access thru back to bottom of main pouch. Included fitted rain cover. Pack exceeded expectations.
customer_reviews.author: jldoc7

product_meta.title: Gregory Mountain Products Zulu 40 Liter Men's Multi Day Hiking Backpack , Burnished Orange, Large
product_meta.description: Size:Large| Color:Burnished OrangeThe Zulu 40 offers more room than a daypack, making it ideal for warm-weather overnights and all-day winter outings. Far lighter, cooler, and more trekkable than an alpine pack, but tough enough to withstand serious use, the Zulu 40 gives you the features and details of a full-sized pack without the weight or the bulk.
feature_bullets: VENTILATED SUSPENSION: Updated CrossFlo Suspension. Dual-density hipbelt and shoulder harness foam for improved heavy load stability.
LOAD BEARING COMFORT & FRONT ZIP ACCESS: Enhanced lumbar foam layering for increased load-bearing comfort. Front U-zip main compartment access panel.
AMPLE STORAGE TO ORGANIZE YOUR TRIP: Permanent top lid with zippered with security pocket and key clip. Front bucket pocket for quick gear storage. Two external stretch water bottle pockets.
EASY ACCESS TO IMPORTANT GEAR: Dual quick-access waist belt pockets. Hideaway ice axe/trekking pole loops. Integrated rain cover. Sunglass stash on shoulder harness.
IDEAL USES: Backpacking, Camping, Hiking, Travel, Trekking - WEIGHT: 2.86 lbs. - DIMENSIONS: 23.5" x 13.5" x 9.5"
Pockets: 1 interior slip, 1 interior zip, 8 exterior

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
